paper_abstract: On every n-long input, every two-way finite automaton (2FA) can reverse its input head O(n) times before halting. A 2FA with few reversals is an automaton where this number is only o(n). For every h, we exhibit a language that can be recognized by an h-state nondeterministic 2FA with few reversals, but requires Omega(2(h)) states on every deterministic 2FA with few reversals. (C) 2012 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Nondeterminism is essential in small two-way finite automata with few reversals
